_header: Early in a summerstide / I saw in London as I went
Title(s): These Lettres XII shall save Mery Englond
_description: ‘These Lettres XII shall save Mery Englond’, on the Yorkist Lords — in quatrains

Lam306.First Lines:
[E]rly in a somerstidey sawe in london as y
                    wente…
Lam306.Last Lines:
…and after this life bryng you and mevnto euer lasting joie
                    amen for charitExplicit
Lam306.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Political, Religious and Love Poems, from Lambeth MS. 306 and other
                sources.
EETS
         o.s. 15 (1866); repr. 1962; rev. ed. 1903: 1-3.

TCD432.First Lines:
Yerly be þe morowe in a somer tydeI saw in a strete in london
                    as I went…
TCD432.Last Lines:
…Hur entent & purpos may last & endureTo þe
                    plesaunce of god & þe welfare of vs all
TCD432.Attributed Title: On the Yorkist Lords (added modern hand; f. 72)
TCD432.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Historical Poems of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         New York: Columbia UP, 1959: 218-21.
